turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: It's so cool. You're by far the most sensational person in the room.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: In the room?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: In the world.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Oh, baby, what's going on?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't know. I'm lost. I'm scared. I feel like I'm disappearing. I'm getting old and nothing makes any sense to me.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Oh, Tangerine.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Nothing makes any sense. Nothing makes any sense.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Come up to Boston with me?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Sure. We'll go next weekend and --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Now. Now! I have to go now. I have to see the frozen Charles! Now! Tonight!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Um, okay. I'll call my study partner.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yay! It'll be great! I'll get my shit.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm so excited. Yay!

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I'm excited, too. Oh, and I wanted to give you this. It's a little... thing.

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: I didn't have a chance to wrap it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's gorgeous.  Just my taste. I've never  gone out with a guy who brought me a piece of jewelry I liked.  Thanks. So let's get going. Long drive.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What's wrong with me?

turns.speaker: PATRICK
turns.text: Nothing is wrong with you. You're the most wonderful person I've ever met.

turns.speaker: MIERZWIAK
turns.text: How are you today?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: MIERZWIAK
turns.text: Well, why don't you tell me what's going on? Do you mind if I turn this on?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, I've been having a bad time of it with um, my boyfriend, I guess.

turns.speaker: MIERZWIAK
turns.text: You guess he's your boyfriend? Or you guess you're having a bad time with him?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What? No. I don't like the term boyfriend. It's so gay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Maybe gay isn't the right word. But, anyway, it's been rough with him... whatever the fuck he is. Heheh. My significant other... heh heh. And I guess on a certain level, I want to break it off, but I feel... y'know... it's like this constant questioning and re questioning. Do I end it? Should I give it more time? I'm not happy, but what do I expect? Relationships require work. You know the drill. The thing that I keep coming back to is, I'm not getting any younger, I want to have a baby... at some point... maybe... right? So then I think I should settle -- which is not necessarily the best word -- I mean, he's a good guy. It's not really settling. Then I think maybe I'm just a victim of movies, y'know? That I have some completely unrealistic notion of what a relationship can be. But then I think, no, this is what I really want, so I should allow myself the freedom to go out and fucking find it. You know? Agreed? But then I think he is a good guy and... It's complicated. Y'know?

turns.speaker: MIERZWIAK
turns.text: I think I know. I think we can help. Why don't you start by telling me about your relationship. Everything you can think of. Everything about him. Everything about you. And we'll take it from there.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Why what?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Why are you sorry? I just said hi.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, I didn't know if you were talking to me, so...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well, I didn't want to assume.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Aw, c'mon, live dangerously. Take the leap and assume someone is talking to you in an otherwise empty car.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Anyway. Sorry. Hi.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's okay if I sit closer? So I don't have to scream. Not that I don't need to scream sometimes, believe me.  But I don't want to bug you if you're trying to write or something.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, I mean, I don't know. I can't really think of much to say probably.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh. So...

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I mean, it's okay if you want to sit down here. I didn't mean to --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No, I don't want to bug you if you're trying to --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's okay, really.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Just, you know, to chat a little, maybe. I have a long trip ahead of me.  How far are you going? On the train, I mean, of course.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Rockville Center.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Get out! Me too! What are the odds?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: The weirder part is I think actually I recognize you. I thought that earlier in the diner. That's why I was looking at you. You work at Borders, right?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Ucch, really? You're kidding. God. Bizarre small world, huh? Yeah, that's me: book slave there for, like, five years now.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Really? Because --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Jesus, is it five years? I gotta quit right now.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: -- because I go there all the time. I don't think I ever saw you before.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, I'm there. I hide in the back as much as is humanly possible. You have a cell phone? I need to quit right this minute. I'll call in dead.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't have one.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'll go on the dole. Like my daddy before me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I noticed your hair. I guess it made an impression on me, that's why I was pretty sure I recognized you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Ah, the hair.  Blue, right? It's called Blue Ruin. The color. Snappy name, huh?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I like it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Blue ruin is cheap gin in case you were wondering.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah. Tom Waits says it in --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Exactly! Tom Waits. Which song?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I can't remember.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Anyway, this company makes a whole line of colors with equally snappy names. Red Menace, Yellow Fever, Green Revolution. That'd be a job, coming up with those names. How do you get a job like that? That's what I'll do. Fuck the dole.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't really know how --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Purple Haze, Pink Eraser.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You think that could possibly be a full time job? How many hair colors could there be?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Someone's got that job.  Agent Orange! I came up with that one. Anyway, there are endless color possibilities and I'd be great at it.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm sure you would.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: My writing career! Your hair written by Clementine Kruczynski.  The Tom Waits album is Rain Dogs.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You sure? That doesn't sound --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I think. Anyway, I've tried all their colors. More than once. I'm getting too old for this. But it keeps me from having to develop an actual personality. I apply my personality in a paste. You?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oh, I doubt that's the case.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, you don't know me, so... you don't know, do you?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sorry. I was just trying to be nice.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah, I got it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: My name's Clementine, by the way.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm Joel.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No jokes about my name? Oh, you wouldn't do that; you're trying to be nice.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know any jokes about your name.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Huckleberry Hound?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know what that means.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Huckleberry Hound! What, are you nuts?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm not nuts.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh my darlin', oh my darlin', oh my darlin' Clementine? No?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sorry. It's a pretty name, though. It means "merciful", right?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah. Although it hardly fits. I'm a vindictive little bitch, truth be told.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: See, I wouldn't think that about you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Why wouldn't you think that about me?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oh. I don't know. I was just... I don't know. I was... You seemed nice, so --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Now I'm nice? Don't you know any other adjectives? There's careless and snotty and overbearing and argumentative... mumpish.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well, anyway... Sorry.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't need nice. I don't need myself to be it and I don't need anyone else to be it at me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Shit. Shit. I know it's here. Hold on.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel? It's Joel, right?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm sorry I... yelled at you. Was it yelling? I can't really tell. Whatever, I'm a little out of sorts today.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: That's okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: My embarrassing admission is I really like that you're nice. Right now, anyway. I can't tell from one moment to the next what I'm going to like. But right now I'm glad you said, "that's okay" to me. That was nice of you.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's no problem. Anyway, I have some stuff I need to --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh, okay. Well, sure, I'll just...  Take care, then.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Probably see you at the book store.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Unless I get that hair-color-naming job.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Hi. I could give you a ride if you need.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No, that's okay. Thanks, though.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You're sure? It's cold.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't want to take you out of your way.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Where do you live?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're not a stalker or anything, right?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well, I probably wouldn't say if I were, but no.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You can't be too careful. I've been stalked. I've been told I'm highly stalkable. I don't need that.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm not a stalker.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You know Wilmont?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Wilmont. Near the high school.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Look, I'm very sorry I came off sort of nutso. I'm not really.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's okay. I didn't think you were.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: So you like bookstores, huh?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I like to read.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Me too. It is Rain Dogs, by the way.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah? I can't remember that album very well. I remember liking it. But --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: The song's 9th and Hennepin. I spent most of the train ride trying to remember. "Till you're full of rag water and bitters and blue ruin/And you spill out/Over the side to anyone who'll listen." Remember?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sort of, um...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Remember? "And you take on the dreams of the ones who have slept there/And I'm lost in the window/I hide on the stairway/I hang in the curtain/I sleep in your hat..."  Oh, shit. I'm so stupid. Sorry.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm just a bit of a wreck. "I sleep in your hat" makes me cry.  Me.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Thanks very much. That was very nice of you.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well, I wouldn't want to be --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh, geez, I'm full of shit. I already told you that.  Anyway. See Ya.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Take care.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Hey, do you want to have a drink? I have lots of drinks. And I could --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Um --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Never mind. Sorry, that was stupid. I'm embarrassed. Good night, Joel.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You like that?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Very much.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: This... someone gave that to me, just like, recently. I like it, too. I like crows. I think I used to be a crow.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Thanks. That was good, that crow sound.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Do you believe in that stuff? Reincarnation?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Me neither. Oh, there's an inscription on the back.  The way a crow/Shook down on me/The dust of snow/From a hemlock tree/Has given my heart/A change of mood/And saved some part/Of a day I rued.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Frost?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah. I'm not, like, a Robert Frost lover by any stretch. His stuff seems strictly grade school to me. But this made me cry for some reason. Maybe because it is grade school. Y'know?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's pretty.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I miss grade school. I don't know why I'm calling it grade school all of a sudden. When I went we called it elementary school. But I like grade school better. Sounds like something someone from the forties would call it. I'd like to be from then. Everyone wore hats. Anyway, cheers!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Cheers.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: God, that feels so fucking good. Take yours off.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah? Well, have a seat, anyway.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Ready for another?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, I'm okay for now.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: What do you want to hear?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You pick it.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You just say. I'm not really --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't know! I can't see them from here, Joel! Just pick something good.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well, I should probably get going.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No, stay. Just for a little while.  Refill?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No. I --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I know a man who needs a refill.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Drink up, young man. It'll make the whole seduction part less repugnant.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Y'know, I'm sort of psychic.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, I go to a psychic and she's always telling me I'm psychic. She should know. Do you believe in that stuff?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Me neither. But sometimes I have premonitions, so, I don't know. Maybe that's just coincidence. Right? Y'know, you think something and then it happens, or you think a word and then someone says it? Y'know?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah, I don't know. It's hard to know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Exactly. Exactly! That's exactly my feeling about it. It's hard to know. Like, okay, but how many times do I think something and it doesn't happen? That's what you're saying, right? You forget about those times. Right?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah, I guess.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: But I think I am. I like to think I am.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's helpful to think there's some order to things. You're kind of closed mouthed, aren't you?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sorry. My life isn't that interesting. I go to work. I go home. I don't know what to say.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh.  Does that make you sad? Or anxious? I'm always anxious thinking I'm not living my life to the fullest, y'know? Taking advantage of every possibility? Just making sure that I'm not wasting one second of the little time I have.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I think about that.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're really nice. I'm sorry I yelled at you before about it. God, I'm an idiot.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I do have a tendency to use that word too much.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I like you. That's the thing about my psychic thing. I think that's my greatest psychic power, that I get a sense about people. My problem is I never trust it. But I get it. And with you I get that you're a really good guy.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: And, anyway, you sell yourself short. I can tell. There's a lot of stuff going on in your brain. I can tell. My goal... can I tell you my goal?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What's the goal, Joel?  My goal, Joel, is to just let it flow through me? Do you know what I mean? It's like, there's all these emotions and ideas and they come quick and they change and they leave and they come back in a different form and I think we're all taught we should be consistent. Y'know? You love someone -- that's it. Forever. You choose to do something with your life -- that's it, that's what you do. It's a sign of maturity to stick with that and see things through. And my feeling is that's how you die, because you stop listening to what is true, and what is true is constantly changing. You know?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah. I think so. It's hard to --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Like I wanted to talk to you. I didn't need any more reason to do it. Who knows what bigger cosmic reason might exist?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're very nice. God, I have to stop saying that. You're nervous around me, huh?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm nervous. You don't need to be nervous around me, though. I like you. Do you think I'm repulsively fat?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, not at all.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't either. I used to. But I'm through with that. Y'know, if I don't love my body, then I'm just lost. You know? With all the wrinkles and scars and the general falling apart that's coming 'round the bend.  So, I've been seeing this guy...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, for the last week, anyway! He's kind of a kid. Kind of a goofball, but he's really stuck on me, which is flattering. Who wouldn't like that? And he's, like, a dope, but he says these smart and moving things sometimes, out of nowhere, that just break my heart. He's the one who gave me that crow photograph.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: That made me cry. But, anyway, we went up to Boston, because I had this urge to lie on my back on the Charles River. It gets frozen this time of year.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: That's scary sounding.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Exactly! I used to do it in college and I had this urge to go do it again, so I got Patrick and we drove all night to get there and he was sweet and said nice things to me, but I was really disappointment to be there with him. Y'know? And that's where psychic stuff comes in. Like, it just isn't right with him. Y'know?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I don't believe in that soulmate crap anymore, but... he says so many great things. We like the same writers. This writer Stephen Dixon he turned me on to. And he's cute. It's fucked up. Joel, you should come up to the Charles with me sometime.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah? Oh, great!

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'll pack a picnic -- a night picnic -- night picnics are different -- and --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sounds good. But right now I should go.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You should stay.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I have to get up early in the morning tomorrow, so...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I would like you to call me. Would you do that? I would like that.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: So, I enjoyed meeting you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You'll call me, right?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Tomorrow?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Tonight. Just to test out the phone lines and all.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: How could she have done this to me? How could anyone do this to anyone?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You didn't say anything about my hair.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yo ho ho!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's three.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I can't believe you wrecked my car. You're driving drunk. It's pathetic.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: ...a little. I was a little tipsy. Don't call me pathetic.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Well it is pathetic. And fucking irresponsible. You could've killed somebody.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know, maybe you did kill somebody.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh Christ I didn't kill anybody. It's just a fucking dent. You're like some old lady or something.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: A wino? Jesus, Are you from the fifties? A wino!  Face it, Joel. You're freaked out because I was out late without you, and in your little wormy brain, you're trying to figure out, did she fuck someone tonight?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, see, Clem, I assume you fucked someone tonight. Isn't that how you get people to like you?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Let me drive you home.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Fuck you, Joel. Faggot.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Look at it out here. It's falling apart. I'm erasing you. And I'm happy.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: How can you watch this crap?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm fucking crawling out of my skin.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oh shit. I remember this.  Want to go?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I want to have a baby.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Let's talk about it later.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No. I want to have a baby. I have to have a baby.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't think we're ready.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're not ready.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Clementine, do you really think you could take care of a kid?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't want to talk about this here.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel, We're fucking gonna talk about it!

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You can't fucking say something like that and say you don't want to talk about it!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Clem, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'd make a fucking good mother! I love children! I'm creative and smart and I'd make a fucking good mother!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oh, thank God. It's going.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's you! It's you who can't commit to anything! You have no idea how lucky you are I'm interested in you! I don't even know why I am! I should just end it right here, Joel. Leave you in the zoo. Maybe you could find a nice sloth to hang out with!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: So, um --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Would you get me another, Joely?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You're drunk.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're a whiz kid. So perceptive, so --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You don't tell me things, Joel. I'm an open book. I tell you everything. Every damn embarrassing thing. You don't trust me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No, it isn't that.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I want to know you.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I just don't have anything very interesting about my life.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel, you're a liar.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: More?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No. Thanks.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joely...

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah, Tangerine?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Do you know The Velveteen Rabbit?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's my favorite book. Since I was a kid. It's about these toys. There's this part where the skin Horse tells the rabbit what it means to be real.  I can't believe I'm crying already. He says, "It takes a long time. That's why it doesn't often happen to people who break easily or have sharp edges, or who have to be carefully kept. Generally by the time you are Real, most of your hair has been loved off, and your eyes drop out and you get loose in the joints and very shabby. But these things don't matter at all, because once you are Real you can't be ugly, except to people who don't understand."

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Such a beautiful view.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yes indeed.  Fuck! They're erasing you, Clem!

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I hired them to. We're in my brain. But I want it to stop, before I wake up and don't know you anymore.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Wow. Um, well... can't you just force yourself awake?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What if you hide me?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well... if they're looking for me in memories I'm in, what if you take me to a memory I'm not in?  And we can hide there till morning.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I want my mommy.  I don't want to lose you, Clem.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm right here.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm scared. I want my mommy. I don't want to lose you. I don't want to lose...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel, Joely, look... it's not fading. The memory. I think we're hidden.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You know, we're okay. They're not finding us. You'll remember me in the morning. And you'll come to me and tell me about us and we'll start over.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I loved you so much this day. On my bed in your panties. I remember I thought, how impossibly lucky am I to have you on my bed in your panties.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You remember what happened next?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I came over to the bed and you smelled so good, like you just woke up, slightly sweaty. And I climbed on the bed with you and you said something like --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: -- another rainy day. Whatever shall we do?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: There's this guy!

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: There's this guy. I heard him talking in my apartment. He's one of the eraser guys. And he fell for you when they were erasing you, so he introduced himself the next day as if he were a stranger and now you're dating him.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Really? Is he cute?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: He stole a pair of your panties while you were being erased!

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Gross! You must remember to tell me this in the morning. I'm, like, so freaked out now.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: But can't you see... I love you, Antoine.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Don't call me Antoine. My name is Wally.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yes, but I can't love a man named Wally.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: They found us before. The plan didn't work. I don't know what to do now.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Hide me somewhere deeper? Somewhere buried?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Look at you, cutey! What are we doing?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: This kid, Joe Early, is going to beat the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't like it either, but I'm just trying to find horrible secret place to --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Happy Birthday.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Thanks, Joely. A present! Oh boy!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I scoured the city for it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I love it!

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm done, Clem. I'm just going to ride it out. Hiding is clearly not working.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I want to enjoy my little time left with you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: This is our first "date" date.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Do you remember what we talked about?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Naomi, I guess.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What was I wearing?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: God, I should know. Your hair was red. I remember it matched the wallpaper.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Egad, were you horrified?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: No! I think you were wearing that black dress, y'know, with the buttons.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Right. Something black though.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'll buy that. Black's always good.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: We did talk about Naomi.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I said: Are you sure? You seem unsure.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm sure, I said.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: But you weren't. I could tell.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I was so nervous. I remember I couldn't think of anything to say. There were long silences.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I thought I was foolish. I thought I'd mistaken infatuation for love. You said:

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: So what. Infatuation is good, too.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: And I didn't have an argument.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I dropped you off after. You said --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Come up and see me... now.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's very late.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yes, exactly. Exactly my point.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I told her today I need to end it.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Is that what you want?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I did it. I guess that means something.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I didn't think you'd show your face around me again. I figured you were humiliated. You did run away, after all.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Sorry to track you down like this. I'm not a stalker. But I needed to see you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'd like to... take you out or something.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, you're married.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Not yet. Not married.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Look, man, I'm telling you right off the bat, I'm high maintenance. So I'm not going to tiptoe around your marriage or whatever it is you got going there. If you want to be with me, you're with me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: So make your domestic decisions and maybe we'll talk again.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel, I'm not a concept. I want you to just keep that in your head. Too many guys think I'm a concept or I complete them or I'm going to make them alive, but I'm just a fucked-up girl who is looking for my own peace of mind. Don't assign me yours.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I remember that speech really well.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I had you pegged, didn't I?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You had the whole human race pegged.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I still thought you were going to save me. Even after that.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It would be different, if we could just give it another go around.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Remember me. Try your best. Maybe we can.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Hi there.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You said...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I saw you sitting over here. By yourself. I thought, thank God, someone normal, who doesn't know how interact at these things either.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah. I don't ever know what to say.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I can't tell you how happy I am to hear that. I mean, I don't mean I'm happy you're uncomfortable, but, yknow... I'm such a loser. Every time I come to a party I tell myself I'm going to be different and it's always exactly the same and then I hate myself after for being such a clod.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Even then I didn't believe you entirely. I thought how could you be talking to me if you couldn't talk to people?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You know what I did.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah, I know. I'm fishing.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You said --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm Clementine. Can I borrow a piece of your chicken?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: And you picked it out of my plate before I could answer and it felt so intimate like we were already lovers.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh God, how horrid.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm Joel.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You mean, like...  Oh, my darlin', oh, my darlin', oh, my darlin', Clementine... ? Huckleberry Hound? That sort of thing?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah, like that.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Nope. No jokes. My favorite thing when I was a kid was my Huckleberry Hound doll. I think your name is magic.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: This is it, Joel. It's gonna be gone soon.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Enjoy it. Say good-bye.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No, I stopped. I didn't want to feel like I was being artificially modulated.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I know what you mean. That's why I stopped.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: But my sleeping is really fucked up.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't think I've slept in a year.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You should try Xanax. I mean, it's a chemical and all, but it works... and it works just having it around, knowing that it's there. Like insurance.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: yeah?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'll give you a couple. See what you think.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Have you ever read any Anna Akhmatova?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I love her.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Really? Me, too! I don't meet people who even know who she is and I work in a book store.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I think she's great.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Me too. There's this poem --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Did this conversation come before or after we saw the house?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I think, before.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Seems too coincidental that way.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah, maybe.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Do you know her poem that starts "Seaside gusts of wind,/And a house in which we don't live...

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. It goes "Perhaps there is someone in this world to whom I could send all these lines"?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yes! I love that poem. It breaks my heart. I'm so excited you know it.  Look, houses in which we don't live.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I wish we did. You married?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Um, no.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Let's move into this neighborhood.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I do sort of live with somebody though.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Male or female?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Female.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: At least I haven't been barking up the wrong tree.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: It's freezing out here.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: C'mon, man. The water's fine. Nobody's coming here tonight, believe me. This place is closed up. Electricity's off.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I hesitated for what seemed like forever.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I could see you wanted to come in, Joel.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I knew.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I knew by your nervousness that Naomi wasn't the kind of girl who forced you to criminally trespass.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's dark.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yeah. What's your girlfriend's name?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Naomi.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Ah-ha! Now I can look for candles, matches, and the liquor cabinet.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I think we should go.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: No, it's our house! Just tonight --  -- we're David and Ruth Laskin. Which one do you want to be? I prefer to be Ruth but I'm flexible.  Alcohol! You make drinks. I'm going find the bedroom and slip into something more Ruth. I'm ruthless at the moment.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: So go.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I did. I walked out the door. I felt like I was a scared little kid. I thought you knew that about me. I ran back to the bonfire, trying to outrun my humiliation. You said, "so go" with such disdain.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What if you stay this time?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I walked out the door. There's no more memory.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Come back and make up a good-bye at least. Let's pretend we had one.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Bye, Joel.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: So you'll call me, right?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Tomorrow?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Tonight. Just to test out the phone lines.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Don't worry. It's really solid this time of year.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know. What if it breaks?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: What if?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I think I should go back.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Joel, come here. Please.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Listen, did you want to make love?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Make love?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Have sex. Y'know --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Oh, um...

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Because I just am not drunk enough or stoned enough to make that happen right now.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: That's okay. I --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm sorry. I just wanted to say that. This seems like the perfect romantic exotic place to do it and --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Hey, Joel --

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: -- and I'm just too nervous around you right now.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I'm nervous, too.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Yeah? I wouldn't have thought that.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, you obviously don't know me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm nervous because I have and enormous crush on you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Says you were closed off, non communicative, never told me what you were feeling.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Says you were a bully...

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: A bully? Moi?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: That's what it says. You drank too much, you picked on me for being passive and timid.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Well, sounds like me. Sorry, man.  Says you were jealous and suspicious.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Says you would sometimes disappear all night, then brag to me about your sexual conquests.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Did I use the term "sexual conquests" or is that your way of putting it.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Doesn't sound like me.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Says you were a slob, leaving trails of panties and dirty socks in your wake.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Says you were constantly calling me a slob.  It's sexy that we were like a married couple, griping and overly-familiar and bored. Don't you think?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I sort of do. But I only see it as a fantasy version of reality. Cleaned up enough to be erotic.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: We should have sex. It's old hat for us.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: You're still excited by my irreverence. You haven't yet started to think of it as my "gratuitous need to shock."

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I can't stop thinking about you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: Yay. Meet me after work by the old mill.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: What old mill? Is that somewhere we --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE
turns.text: I just wanted to say that. Come by my house.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: What took you so long?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I just walked in.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Hmmm. Do you miss me?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Oddly enough, I do.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Ha Ha! You said, I do. I guess that means we're married.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Tomorrow night... honeymoon on ice.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Did you send this? Is it a joke?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: I probably got the same thing as you.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I mean, I haven't even told anyone I've met you. Who would even know to do this?

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Maybe it's true then. It's my voice on the tape.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: That's what you have to say? How could it be true? I never even heard of any procedure like this. It's a joke.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: It's true.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: I know. I spoke to my friend Magda.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Look, I have to go. I have to think.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Joel, we've fucked. We've made love. Like a million times. And we were so sweet and shy and inept with each other last night. Isn't that lovely?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Hi, it's Joel.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Hey, lover. Whatcha doing?

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I'm just, y'know, passing the time best I can till I can see you.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: God, I can't believe I ever hated you.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: You must have been crazy.

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Guess what I'm wearing.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: I don't know. Panties and --

turns.speaker: CLEMENTINE'S VOICE
turns.text: Your dried cum.

turns.speaker: JOEL
turns.text: Jesus.
